text: Is there an easy way to check if two sets have an not null intersection?

elements.text: Is there an easy way to check if two sets have an not null intersection?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

one option is
```julia> function nonemptyintersection(A, B)
           if length(A) >= length(B)
               A, B = B, A
           end
           for a in A
               a in B && return true
           end
           return false
       end
nonemptyintersection (generic function with 1 method)

julia> nonemptyintersection(1:10, 9:15)
true

julia> nonemptyintersection(1:10, 11:15)
false```

elements.text:
julia> function nonemptyintersection(A, B)
           if length(A) >= length(B)
               A, B = B, A
           end
           for a in A
               a in B && return true
           end
           return false
       end
nonemptyintersection (generic function with 1 method)

julia> nonemptyintersection(1:10, 9:15)
true

julia> nonemptyintersection(1:10, 11:15)
false

text:
```julia> isempty( (1:5) ∩ (6:10))
true

julia> isempty( (1:5) ∩ (4:10))
false```
You can type the intersection symbol with `\cap<TAB>`

elements.text:
julia> isempty( (1:5) ∩ (6:10))
true

julia> isempty( (1:5) ∩ (4:10))
false
